comments:
During my work with eclipse I get several crashes a day. Afterwards I always have to 
delete the .classpath and .project in order to get the eclipse running again.  
In the following I put the logfile in order to give you more infos. (It would be a good 
idea to extend the bugzilla functionality to a 'submit logfile' feature!) 
 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Many of the errors are coming from a plugin that is not part of the eclipse
platform: com.omondo.uml.  We can't help you with these errors.  If this plugin
is misbehaving, it may be cause of the other errors as well. I suggest that you
try running without that plugin to see if the problems go away.

Also, you should never delete your .project file... this will only cause further
errors since you are deleting essential project metadata.

This bug can probably be marked invalid, but I'm move to JDT UI for comment on
the two NPEs in the log:

java.lang.NullPointerException 
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.buildpaths.BuildPathsBlock.init(BuildPathsBlock.java:315)

java.lang.NullPointerException 
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.buildpaths.LibrariesWorkbookPage.openJarFileDialog(LibrariesWorkbookPage.java:520)

Both NPEs are fixed in the 3.0 stream and they can't produce the described 
behaviour. I agree with John that you should talk to the team that implements 
the UML plug-in.
